Sentencas: The performance and stability of solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) depend on the microstructure of the electrode and electrolyte.
Titulo: Optimization of anode and electrolyte microstructure for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: In anode, porosity and pore distribution affect the active site and fuel gas transfer.
Titulo: Optimization of anode and electrolyte microstructure for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: In an electrolyte, density and thickness determine the ohmic resistance.
Titulo: Optimization of anode and electrolyte microstructure for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: To optimizing these conditions, using costly method cannot be a suitable research plan for aiming at commercialization.
Titulo: Optimization of anode and electrolyte microstructure for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: To solve these drawbacks, we made high performance unit cells with low cost and highly efficient ceramic processes.
Titulo: Optimization of anode and electrolyte microstructure for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: We selected the NiO-YSZ cermet that is a commercial anode material and used facile methods like die pressing and dip coating process.
Titulo: Optimization of anode and electrolyte microstructure for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The porosity of anode was controlled by the amount of carbon black (CB) pore former from 10 wt% to 20 wt% and final sintering temperature from 1350 degrees C to 1450 degrees C. To achieve a dense thin film electrolyte, the thickness and microstructure of electrolyte were controlled by changing the YSZ loading (vol%) of the slurry from 1 vol% to 5 vol.
Titulo: Optimization of anode and electrolyte microstructure for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: From results, we achieved the 40% porosity that is well known as an optimum value in Ni-YSZ anode, by adding 15wt% of CB and sintering at 1350 degrees C. YSZ electrolyte thickness was controllable from 2 mu m to 28 mu m and dense microstructure is formed at 3vol% of YSZ loading via dip coating process.
Titulo: Optimization of anode and electrolyte microstructure for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Finally, a unit cell composed of Ni-YSZ anode with 40% porosity, YSZ electrolyte with a 22 mu m thickness and LSM-YSZ cathode had a maximum power density of 1.426 Wcm(-2) at 800 degrees C.
Titulo: Optimization of anode and electrolyte microstructure for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells
